item.title: Pollution Curbs Under GRAP-3 Revoked In Delhi As Air Quality Improves - NDTV
item.description:
Pollution Curbs Under GRAP-3 Revoked In Delhi As Air Quality Improves

Publication Date: Recent
Source: NDTV

The pollution curbs in Delhi under GRAP-3 have been lifted due to improvements in air quality following continuous rains. The AQI has shown a downward trend and is expected to remain in the 'poor' category for the next few days.

  • Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) 3 curbs lifted as air quality improves.
  • Continuous rains have contributed to a decrease in the AQI levels.
  • Restrictions on diesel generators and construction activities are being eased, but some areas remain under closure orders.
  • Stage I & II of the revised GRAP will remain in effect to monitor air quality.
“Actions under Stage I & II of the revised GRAP shall remain invoked and be implemented, monitored and reviewed by all the agencies concerned in the entire NCR.”

This move marks a shift in response to improved environmental conditions, as the seasonal pollution issues are still anticipated.

item.title: Madras High Court Takes Suo Motu Cognizance Of Alleged Sexual Assault Of Student At Anna University - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Madras High Court Takes Suo Motu Cognizance Of Alleged Sexual Assault Of Student At Anna University

Publication Date: December 27, 2023

Source: Madras High Court

The Madras High Court has taken cognizance of the alleged sexual assault of a second-year engineering student at Anna University in Chennai, following a letter from Advocate R Varalakshmi.

  • The incident happened on December 23 when the accused allegedly recorded a video of the girl and her male friend before assaulting her.
  • The bench noted the need for procedural adherence before action can be taken and awaits formal orders from the Chief Justice.
  • The Advocate General assured the court that the state would file a status report on the investigation.
  • Concerns have been raised regarding campus safety and the history of the accused, who has previous sexual assault cases against him.
  • The National Commission for Women has also responded, calling for stricter punishments related to leakage of FIR details.
“We've made an attempt to get orders from the Chief Justice...There's a procedure to be followed. So we'll have to wait for the official orders,” said the court.

The court's reaction highlights the ongoing issues surrounding campus security and the legal processes to ensure justice and safety for students.

item.title: "Friend, Philosopher, Guide": Sonia Gandhi Remembers Manmohan Singh - NDTV

item.title: China defends plan to build world's largest dam over Brahmaputra River in Tibet - Hindustan Times
item.description:
China Defends the Construction of the World's Largest Dam Over the Brahmaputra River

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Chinese foreign ministry announced plans for a $137 billion dam on the Brahmaputra River in Tibet, asserting that it will not adversely affect neighboring countries along the river.

  • The dam is part of a major infrastructure project in the ecologically sensitive Himalayan region.
  • China claims it has conducted extensive studies to ensure the project's safety and environmental impact.
  • Work on the dam aims to foster international cooperation on disaster prevention and relief.
  • Construction will take at least a decade and will connect to the grid further east.
  • Concerns have been raised about potential water flow reductions affecting downstream countries, especially India.
“Everybody downstream is going to be concerned about what it means if water flow is reduced. I know India is very anxious about it.” - David Fishman, energy consulting firm

This ambitious project highlights the complexities of managing international rivers and the geopolitical implications for neighboring nations.

item.title: 8 Dead, 26 hurt as bus plunges into drain in Punjab - The Times of India
item.description:
Bus Accident in Punjab Leaves 8 Dead and 26 Injured

Publication Date: October 6, 2023
Source: Times of India

This tragic incident occurred when a bus plunged into a drain in Punjab, resulting in multiple fatalities and injuries.

  • 8 people lost their lives in the accident.
  • 26 individuals sustained injuries, with varying degrees of severity.
  • The accident has sparked significant concern over road safety standards in the region.
  • Rescue operations were launched immediately to assist the victims.
"This is a heartbreaking tragedy that could have been avoided with better road safety measures." - Local Official

The accident highlights the need for improved infrastructure and safety precautions on roads to prevent such incidents in the future.

item.title: Heavy Rain In Delhi Causes Severe Waterlogging, 'Orange' Alert Issued: Latest Weather Updates - News18
item.description:
Heavy Rain In Delhi Causes Severe Waterlogging, 'Orange' Alert Issued: Latest Weather Updates

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: News

Delhi experienced heavy rainfall and lightning today as the cold wave intensified. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted thunderstorms, hailstorms, and moderate rainfall across northwestern and central India on December 27 and 28 due to an active western disturbance.

  • Temperature in Delhi stood at 13 degree Celsius at 7:23am.
  • The maximum temperature expected to reach 20 degrees Celsius, with a minimum of 12 degrees Celsius.
  • Heavy rain and strong winds forecasted for December 27th and 28th.
  • IMD issued warnings for hailstorms in several northern states.
  • Delhi’s air quality remains ‘very poor’, with some improvement expected.
“On December 27 and 28, Madhya Pradesh is likely to face similar conditions.”

The weather department's warnings indicate serious impacts on daily life in Delhi and surrounding areas, highlighting the need for precautionary measures.

item.title: 'Manmohan Singh preferred Maruti 800 over BMW': UP minister shares anecdote about ex-PM - The Times of India
item.description:
Manmohan Singh preferred Maruti 800 over BMW: UP minister shares anecdote about ex-PM

Publication Date: Current Date | Source: Times of India

The Uttar Pradesh minister shared a light-hearted memory about former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh preferring a humble Maruti 800 over a luxurious BMW, highlighting his simplicity and down-to-earth nature.

  • The anecdote reflects the character of Manmohan Singh during his tenure as Prime Minister.
  • It emphasizes Singh's preference for practicality over luxury.
  • The minister's story aims to evoke nostalgia among many who admired Singh.
“Manmohan Singh was a leader who valued simplicity above all.”

This anecdote serves as a reminder of the leaders who prioritize accessibility and relatability in their public image.

item.title: Manmohan Singh Death News Updates: ‘A setback for the whole nation,’ says PM Modi, calls former PM an ‘inspiration for coming generations’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Manmohan Singh Death News Updates

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: Indian Express

Dr Manmohan Singh, the two-time prime minister and the architect of India's landmark economic reforms of 1991, passed away at the age of 92. He died late Thursday evening in Delhi. His remains were taken to his residence for the final respects.

  • Dr Singh's last rites will take place near Rajghat after a tribute at AICC headquarters.
  • Political leaders including PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah paid their respects on Friday morning.
  • Manmohan Singh was pivotal in economic reforms and signed the civil nuclear deal with the US in 2005.
“A setback for the whole nation,” says PM Modi, remembering Singh as an inspiration for future generations.

In conclusion, Dr Manmohan Singh's passing marks the end of an era in Indian politics, celebrating his legacy as a transformative leader.

item.title: Watch: Man travels 250 km under train bogie before being spotted in Madhya Pradesh - The Times of India
item.description:
Man Travels 250 km Under Train Bogie in Madhya Pradesh

Publication Date: [INSERT DATE] Source: Times of India

An extraordinary incident occurred in Madhya Pradesh where a man traveled approximately 250 kilometers clinging to the undercarriage of a train bogie before being discovered.

  • The man was spotted underneath a train in Madhya Pradesh after enduring a perilous journey.
  • Authorities were alerted upon noticing the unusual situation, prompting an investigation.
  • The reasons for the man's action remain unclear, raising questions about safety and awareness near railway lines.
"This incident highlights the dangers associated with train travel and the need for enhanced safety measures around railway tracks."

The event has sparked discussions on railway safety and the lengths individuals might go to for various reasons, highlighting pressing issues surrounding public transportation and safety protocols.

item.title: Tamil Nadu BJP leader Annamalai whips himself in protest against Anna University sexual assault - The Hindu
item.description:
Tamil Nadu BJP Leader Annamalai Protests with Self-Flagellation Against Sexual Assault Incident

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: The Hindu

K. Annamalai, president of the Tamil Nadu BJP, protested the sexual assault of a girl at Anna University by flogging himself in front of party workers in Coimbatore.

  • He performed the act barefoot as a symbolic gesture against the DMK government.
  • He whipped himself six times while addressing supporters and journalists.
  • Annamalai stated that this agitation is aimed at broader issues such as declining education standards, economic decline, and police inaction regarding women's safety.
  • He mentioned a past case from his police days that profoundly affected his decision to enter politics.
  • Annamalai criticized police accountability and the handling of FIRs related to sexual assault cases.
  • He announced that he would refrain from wearing footwear until the current government is replaced.
“After deep deliberation, I took a decision not to wear footwear until the DMK government that has indulged in all wrongdoings is ousted.”

This protest reflects deep-seated frustrations with governance and the handling of women's safety issues in Tamil Nadu.

item.title: He Preferred Maruti 800 Over BMW: Manmohan Singh’s SPG Security Incharge Shares Heartwarming Side Of Former PM - Zee News
item.description:
Heartwarming Memories of Manmohan Singh’s Simplicity and Attachment to Maruti 800

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: Zee News

Following the passing of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, Asim Arun, his former SPG security incharge, shared touching memories highlighting Singh's preference for his Maruti 800 over more luxurious cars.

Key points about Singh's simplicity and character include:

  • Asim Arun recalled Manmohan Singh's single attachment to his Maruti 800 throughout his tenure.
  • Singh’s preference was not for luxury; he expressed that his car was his Maruti 800.
  • He had a life-long commitment to relating with and worrying for the common person.
  • Sinha passed away at age 92 due to an age-related medical condition.
“I do not like to travel in this car, my car is this one (Maruti).” - Manmohan Singh

Manmohan Singh will be remembered for his commitment to simplicity, even as Prime Minister, choosing to drive a Maruti 800 instead of more luxurious vehicles.

item.title: Gandhis Pay Tribute To Dr Manmohan Singh: Updates - NDTV
item.description:
Gandhis Pay Tribute To Dr Manmohan Singh: Updates

Publication Date: December 27, 2024

Source: NDTV

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's passing has led to an outpouring of tributes from leaders across the political spectrum. His last journey will begin tomorrow from the All India Congress Committee headquarters at 9:30 am.

  • His mortal remains will be open for public tributes at his residence until the morning.
  • A 7-day state mourning has been declared across the country.
  • Leaders like PM Modi and former President Ram Nath Kovind have paid their respects, highlighting Singh's significant contributions.
  • The Indian cricket team wore black armbands in tribute during their ongoing Test match.
  • Many states have announced mourning in honor of the former PM.
“A man of virtue, impeccable integrity, marked above all by a humane touch in decision making.” — Ram Nath Kovind

The widespread recognition of Singh's legacy underscores his impact on India's economic reforms and strategic partnerships globally.

item.title: Tamil Nadu BJP's Annamalai whips himself seeking justice in Anna University sexual assault case | Video - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BJP Leader Annamalai Protests for Justice in Anna University Assault Case

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Tamil Nadu Bharatiya Janata Party president K Annamalai has protested in Coimbatore by whipping himself to demand justice for a 19-year-old girl allegedly sexually assaulted at Anna University.

  • Annamalai announced plans to fast for 48 days and vowed to not wear footwear until the DMK is removed from power.
  • He held a press conference stating he will whip himself six times as part of his protest.
  • Protests by BJP and AIADMK leaders occurred on December 26, resulting in police detentions.
  • The BJP leader criticized the DMK government for rising crimes against women in Tamil Nadu.
  • Police confirmed the arrest of an individual linked to the case.
“This is atrocious. They want to crush our voice.” - Tamilisai Soundararajan

The protest highlights significant public dissent regarding safety and justice for women in Tamil Nadu.

item.title: Supreme Court frowns upon farmers objecting to hospitalisation of Jagjit Singh Dallewal - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Expresses Concern Over Farmers Blocking Medical Aid for Jagjit Singh Dallewal

Published on: 27 Dec 2024, 7:34 am

The Supreme Court has raised concerns regarding farmers obstructing medical assistance to Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who is on a fast unto death. The court has ordered the Punjab government to ensure medical care for him.

  • The Supreme Court questioned farmers for obstructing medical aid to Dallewal.
  • Justices Surya Kant and Sudhanshu Dhulia expressed serious doubts about the protests.
  • The court emphasized the urgency of providing medical aid, stating a life is at stake.
  • Punjab government faced scrutiny for not complying with prior orders to hospitalize Dallewal.
  • Dallewal is on an indefinite fast demanding a legal guarantee of minimum support price for crops.
Justice Kant stated, "Somebody's life at stake. You need to take it seriously. Medical aid has to be given and the impression is that you are not following it.".

The court has ordered compliance from the Punjab officials by tomorrow and expressed its primary concern for Dallewal's health and safety.

item.title: Student sexual assault case: Tamil Nadu BJP chief Annamalai stages whiplash agitation - The Indian Express
item.description:
Tamil Nadu BJP Chief Stages Unique Protest

Date: December 27, 2024
Source: Indian Express

Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai staged a unique agitation in Coimbatore on Friday when he flogged himself condemning the ruling DMK and the state police over the handling of the case of sexual assault on a Chennai college student on Christmas eve.

  • Annamalai, clad in green dhoti and bare-chested, whipped himself repeatedly in front of his residence.
  • The protest was to condemn the police for the alleged leak of the FIR pertaining to the woman’s complaint.
  • Annamalai earlier removed his shoes at a press conference, vowing not to wear footwear until the DMK government is dislodged.
"VIDEO | BJP Tamil Nadu president K Annamalai whips himself outside his residence in Coimbatore to condemn the police, and the state government for their ‘apathy’ in handling the case of sexual assault of a student of Anna University."

One person has been arrested in connection with the incident that happened inside Anna University.

item.title: Manmohan Singh's decisions that shaped a billion lives - BBC.com
item.description:
Manmohan Singh's Contributions and Milestones in Indian Politics

Publication Date: Source: BBC News

People in India are reflecting on former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's contributions to the country following his recent passing. Singh's leadership and policies, particularly his role in India's economic liberalization, have had a profound impact on over a billion lives.

  • Singh served as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014, becoming known as an architect of India's economic reforms.
  • He initiated significant economic liberalization in the 1990s while serving as Finance Minister.
  • His leadership saw India's GDP grow substantially during his tenure.
  • Singh introduced several key reforms improving education, rural employment, and access to information.
  • He also formally apologized for the anti-Sikh riots, marking a historical acknowledgment of past injustices.
  • In 2008, he signed a landmark nuclear deal with the US, enhancing India's global standing.
“I have no hesitation in apologising to the Sikh community. I apologise not only to the Sikh community but to the whole Indian nation.”

Manmohan Singh's policies and decisions have left an enduring legacy in Indian society, highlighting the complexity and impact of his leadership.

item.title: Manmohan Singh death: As mark of respect, Congress cancels all programmes for next seven days - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress Cancels Programs for a Week in Honor of Manmohan Singh

Publication Date: December 27, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The Congress party has announced the cancellation of all official programmes for the next seven days in memory of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who passed away at the age of 92.

  • Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh died at AIIMS, New Delhi.
  • The Congress has cancelled its foundation day celebrations and all other official events.
  • Congress flag will be flown at half-mast during this mourning period.
  • Party activities are set to resume on January 3, 2025.
  • Singh's death was announced at the conclusion of a Congress Working Committee meeting in Belagavi, Karnataka.
“Party programmes will resume on 3rd January 2025,” said K C Venugopal.

The Congress party is in a period of mourning as they honor the legacy of Dr. Manmohan Singh, who was instrumental in India’s economic reforms.

item.title: Anna University rape case: BJP’s Annamalai whips himself outside Coimbatore residence to protest against - The Times of India
item.description:
Anna University rape case: BJP’s Annamalai whips himself outside Coimbatore residence to protest against DMK govt

Publication Date: [Insert Date] - Source: [Insert Source]

A BJP leader, Annamalai, has sparked controversy by whipping himself outside his Coimbatore residence to protest against the DMK government following a shocking rape case involving Anna University.

  • The incident has intensified debates surrounding safety measures for women in educational institutions.
  • Protests have erupted demanding justice for the victim and accountability from the authorities.
  • The BJP claims the current government is failing to protect women.
“We will not remain silent until justice is served,” Annamalai stated during the protest.

This incident has highlighted ongoing concerns about women's safety and government accountability in Tamil Nadu.

item.title: Manmohan Singh preferred his Maruti 800 over BMW: U.P. Minister recalls his experience with former PM - The Hindu
item.description:
Manmohan Singh Preferred His Maruti 800 Over BMW, Reveals U.P. Minister

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The recent tribute to former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh by U.P. Minister Asim Arun showcases Singh's deep connection with the middle class through his choice of a modest vehicle over luxury.

  • Manmohan Singh preferred a Maruti Suzuki 800 over a BMW, reflecting his humility.
  • Arun shared personal anecdotes of his time as Singh's protection officer, highlighting Singh's simple lifestyle.
  • The former PM's death was noted shortly before the memoir was shared.
“Asim, I don't like travelling in this car (BMW). My car is the Maruti.”

This choice symbolizes not just simplicity, but also Singh's commitment to the common man, making him a beloved figure in Indian politics.

item.title: ICAI Result: 4 candidates top CA Final exam, country gets 11,500 new Chartered Accountants - Hindustan Times
item.description:
ICAI CA Final Result 2024: A total of 11,500 candidates qualified as Chartered Accountants, the Insitute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has announced.

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The ICAI has announced that a total of 11,500 candidates have successfully qualified as Chartered Accountants this year, emphasizing the impressive performance of students.

  • Heramb Maheshwari from Hyderabad and Rishab Ostwal R from Tirupati jointly secured the all-India first rank.
  • Riya Kunjankumar Shah from Ahmedabad is the second topper.
  • Kinjal Ajmera from Kolkata secured the third rank.
  • Total candidates who appeared: 66,987; total passed: 11,253 in Group 1 with a pass percentage of 16.8%.
  • In Group 2, 49,459 candidates wrote the exam; 10,566 passed with a pass percentage of 21.36%.
  • For candidates appearing in both groups, 30,763 showed up, with 4,134 passing (13.44% pass rate).
"Individual exam results can be accessed at the institute's result portal, icai.nic.in."

The successful results of this examination highlight the continued demand and rigorous standards in the field of Chartered Accountancy in India.

item.title: Manmohan Singh death: Are banks, schools closed today (December 27)? Check details - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Manmohan Singh Death: Impact on Schools and Banks in India

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh passed away at the age of 92. The Union government declared seven days of mourning, but so far, only Karnataka has officially declared a holiday for schools and colleges.

  • The Union Cabinet will meet on December 27 to pay tribute to Manmohan Singh.
  • National Flag will be at half-mast with no official entertainment during the mourning period.
  • No official announcement yet on bank closures on December 27; digital banking services will remain operational.
  • Karnataka has declared a holiday for schools and colleges.
  • Awaiting announcements from other states regarding educational institutions.
“History will be kinder to me than the media.” - Manmohan Singh

This event marks a significant moment in Indian history, as it affects political rituals and public observance nationwide.

item.title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy announces Cabinet sub-committee 'to resolve problems of Telugu cinema' amid Pushpa 2 case - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Telangana CM Revanth Reddy Announces Cabinet Sub-Committee for Telugu Cinema Issues

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Chief Minister Revanth Reddy recently addressed members of the Telugu film industry, outlining significant measures to support its growth and prosperity amidst ongoing controversies.

  • A Cabinet Sub-Committee will be established to address the concerns of the Telugu film industry.
  • Film producer Dil Raju appointed as Chairman of the Film Development Corporation (FDC).
  • Government issued special orders for eight films and provided police grounds for filming Pushpa-2.
  • CM Reddy emphasizes promoting eco-tourism and temple tourism as part of industry support.
  • Criticism arises from BJP leader Amit Malviya regarding the government's alleged targeting of Tollywood.
CM Reddy stated, "A Cabinet Sub-Committee will be constituted to resolve the problems of the Telugu film industry."

The Telangana government's response aims to enhance support for the local film industry and address ongoing challenges, promoting Hyderabad as a competitive hub for film production.

item.title: Chennai rape case: Rapist knew layout of Anna University campus well & entered at will - The Times of India
item.description:
Chennai rape case: Rapist knew layout of Anna University campus well & entered at will

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

This article discusses the recent rape case in Chennai, highlighting how the perpetrator was familiar with the Anna University campus, allowing him to enter without raising suspicion.

  • The rapist had prior knowledge of the campus layout.
  • Authorities are investigating security vulnerabilities at educational institutions.
  • This incident has raised concerns about student safety on campus.
  • The case has garnered widespread media attention and public outcry.
“The familiarity of the assailant with the university grounds is alarming and points to serious lapses in security.”

This incident underscores the need for improved safety measures in educational institutions to protect students from violence.

item.title: China to build world's biggest dam near border; India waits & watches - The Times of India
item.description:
China to Build World's Biggest Dam Near India Border

Date: October 2023

Source: [News Source]

China has announced plans to construct the world's largest dam near its border with India, raising concerns in India regarding potential impacts on water resources and regional stability.

  • The dam project is expected to be the largest of its kind globally.
  • Indian officials are monitoring the situation closely.
  • The project may affect the water supply to several regions in India.
  • This move could escalate tensions in an already strained Indo-China relationship.
“We are keeping a close watch on these developments and considering diplomatic options.” - Indian Government Official

The construction of this dam could lead to significant geopolitical ramifications, particularly concerning water security and bilateral relations between India and China.

item.title: Manmohan Singh passes away, Live Updates: Former PM’s body being taken out of AIIMS, 7-day national mourning to be declared - The Indian Express
item.description:
Manmohan Singh passes away, Live Updates

Date: Not Provided Source: The Indian Express

Dr Manmohan Singh, two-time prime minister and architect of the landmark economic reforms of 1991, has passed away at the age of 92. The news of his passing was announced by the hospital shortly after he was admitted to the AIIMS Delhi in critical condition. A national mourning of seven days will be declared, and Singh’s last rites will be conducted with full state honours.

  • Dr Singh was a notable economist and former governor of the Reserve Bank of India.
  • He led India during a significant economic reform period and signed the civil nuclear deal with the USA.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi paid tributes, describing him as a distinguished leader with immense wisdom.
“His legacy will endure in the nation’s history.” - Narendra Modi

The Cabinet is set to meet tomorrow for further arrangements.
